issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fixVersions.description: Dynamic Reconfig, Remove Watches, Local Session

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

versions.description: Dynamic Reconfig, Remove Watches, Local Session

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: server
components.description: General issues with the ZooKeeper server.

fields.description:
TruncateTest has been failing consistently on windows:

https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk-WinVS2008_java/627/testReport/junit/org.apache.zookeeper.test/TruncateTest/testTruncate/

comments.body:
-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12619065/ZOOKEEPER-1844.patch
  against trunk revision 1551366.

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    -1 core tests.  The patch failed core unit tests.

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1843//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1843//artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/1843//console

This message is automatically generated.
Is this an issue for 3.4.6 as well?

Yes, this is an issue for 3.4.6 as well, although the test seems to fail only in trunk.

Rakesh, I tried your patch, but the test still fails with the same error:

{noformat}

This message is automatically generated.
Is this for 3.5.0 only?

Hi [~fpj], [~michim], [~phunt], 
Actually I've observed the following two cases:

# FileTxnLog.java - 'logStream' is not getting closed after the rollover. I have seen it is not affecting anywhere, because there is 'streamsToFlush' collection in place, which will be closed always. I think logStream#closure is good to have kind of. In my patch I didn't included this change and after the discussion if required will modify the patch with 'logStream#close'.
# FileTxnIterator is keeping PositionInputStream reference and is not closed properly in many places.

As [~michim] mentioned earlier, the test case is failing only in trunk, but this is an issue for 3.4.6 as well. IMHO, FileTxnIterator closure needs improvement in both 3.4 branch as well as trunk.

Thank you Michi for the feedback which gave confidence to move on.

Attached latest patch, includes following changes:
FilTxneSnapLog#restore - closed iterator in finally block
LearnerHandler - Provided conditional closing by using instanceof TxnLogProposalIterator checks. Also added one test case for covering this logic.

Hi Michi/Flavio/Patrick,

Could you please review the latest patch. I feel this should go to 3.4 branch as well, shall I mark fix for 3.4 and move this to the sub-task of ZOOKEEPER-1833. If you agree, I'll upload the patch for 3.4 branch version, once I get a +1 for the trunk patch.

Hi All, The same is failing in latest trunk build also and if we push this in, it will reduce one test failure and will make one step ahead to a clean build.

https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk-WinVS2008_java/651/testReport/junit/org.apache.zookeeper.test/TruncateTest/testTruncate/
This one is marked for 3.4.6, but it only has a trunk patch. [~rakeshr], do you have a 3.4 patch for this one?
ok. I'll get the 3.4 patch in sometime.

[~fpj] Thanks for the interest. Attached branch 3.4 patch, could you please look at it.
Also, I had done the following changes in existing trunk patch.
 - Modified String concatenation in logs
- Modified TruncateTest.java by including verification for zkdb#truncateLog
